Class TiddlySaver

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • java.applet.Applet
            • TiddlySaver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class TiddlySaver
extends java.applet.Applet
    TiddlySaver Applet.

    If there is a method to communicate a meaningful java exception to javascript I have not found it yet. If we want to retain compatiblity to the old javascript code we are constrained by the old interface. Old javascript code had to handle exceptions. It's ugly as hell but this is the current approach:
    * Signal an error by throwing an exception
    * JavaScript may query the text / stacktrace of the last exception.
    * As long as the browsers are not multithreading the javascript this should work
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
